column4: hi! When i boot my computer, 1 out of 3 times i reach bios, where i enter the correct HDD to boot to, and when i choose "save changes and exit", and the computer boots, the screen just stays black. Why is that? And then the next time i manage to get it booting, it wont remember my changes in bios.
Try to update your bios, but be CAREFUL :-))
right now i cant even reach bios. stupid computer wont even boot up so i can see bios.
Have you changed any BIOS setting?
try to remove one of your RAM modules (assuming you have more than one)
ok, i have 2. Ill remove the second one.
read what i wrote last time. any comments?
I didn't see that, since I lost my connection...
okey, so this is the plan now, remove and reconnect all connectors. And then reboot an assload of times until it works
sounds good... If you have a older motherboard with SATA-harddrives attached, check them as well
some old motherboards do have problems with SATA-cabels, that may glitch
ok, brb with results..
Nope, it isn't, try with replacing that battery
so, all you get is a black screen after you picked out, the battery, is that correct?
after i picked out the battery i goit this screen saying my battery was low. When i clicked f1 to continue pretty much nothing happen
okey, here is what I would do in your place: 1. Remove the battery and take it to a clock store or some computer store.
2. After you done that, you may use  "Ultimate Boot CD" to check your hardware
kinda hard to do that, considering how i cant even reach bios.
Yes, that's why I suggest you take your cmos-battery to a computer store, so they can replace it for you
ok, ill look into that.
AFTER you try that, you should hopefully be able to use Ultimate boot cd to check your hardware
